Hover.css v2

\n\n\t\t

A collection of CSS3 powered hover effects to be applied to links, buttons, logos, SVG, featured images and so on. Easily apply to your own elements, modify or just use for inspiration. Available in CSS, Sass, and LESS.

\n\n\t\t

About Hover.css

\n\n\t\t\t\t

All Hover.css effects make use of a single element (with the help of some pseudo-elements where necessary), are self contained so you can easily copy and paste them, and come in CSS, Sass, and LESS flavours.

\n\n\t\t\t\t

For best results, hover effects use a couple of \"hacks\" (undesirable but usually necessary lines of code). For more information on these hacks and whether you need them, please read the FAQ.

\n\n\t\t\t\t

Many effects use CSS3 features such as transitions, transforms and animations. Old browsers that don't support these features may need some extra attention to be certain a fallback hover effect is still in place.

\n\n\t\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t

License

\n\n\t\t\t\t

Hover.css is open source, and made available under a MIT License. Distribute, use as-is, or modify to your liking in personal and commercial projects. Please retain the original readme and license files.\n\n\t\t\t\t

Placing author information in your stylesheet, credits page or humans.txt is much appreciated.

\n\n\t\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t

Hover.css is now available as an Eager App

\n\t\t\t\t

Quickly and easily install Hover.css on your WordPress site or via an embed code with Eager app.
